questionsData.title: Acidity can be measured by a thermometer.
questionsData.explain_answer: a thermometer cannot measure acidity. Acidity is measured by a pH meter.

questionsData.title: The particles in a boiling kettle move faster and faster.
People use convex lenses in order to read well.
We can measure sounds in hertz and decibels.
Cowpox only found in monkeys.
The moon orbits the sun.
The ruler is round in shape.
questionsData.explain_answer: No, the statement "The ruler is round in shape" is incorrect. Rulers are typically flat and straight, designed to measure straight lines.

questionsData.title: Unusual animal is an unordinary animal.
A valley is a place where nothing is grown.
A reckless person is a careful person.
In epidemic the earth moves and shakes.
Loss of lives means too many people died.
To take charge of is to be irresponsible.
Application form is a piece of paper.
Life-guard is a person who tames lions.
Individual and group are antonyms.
Endless list is the list which has no end.
Olives are small black or green fruit.
Riddles are the antonyms of puzzles.
"The visibility was excellent" means "could be seen clearly".
The text is mainly talking about……
questionsData.article: The first migrations in human history was probably voluntary. People choose to leave their birthplace in search of food, water, or living space. The second kind of migration has been involuntary, which means that people were forced to travel. Between the 16th and 19th centuries, for instance, European slave traders (kidnapped 1) an immense number of African natives and transported them against their will to the Americas. There, the Africans encountered a world unlike anything (they 3) had ever seen in their native lands. They were forced to work in terrible conditions, and many died young. The practice of slavery declined in the 18th and the 19th centuries. Subsequently, it was made (illegal 2), and the descanters of those early African slaves became free. Africans were absorbed into the cultures of the Americans, and today they are described, for example, as African Americans, Afro-Caribbean, or Afro-Latin Americans. In recent years, DNA researchers linked the DNA of all humans on our planet with the DNA of African natives. The European slave traders probably would have found it incredible to think that people all over the world were, in sense, related to each other.

questionsData.title: Do we have …… sugar left?
One of the following is a compound word.
Some shopkeepers up the prices daily. The word "up" is a/an
……. is a suffix.
A stream is …… a river.
The red sea is not as ……as the Atlantic ocean.
I am not interested……watching action films.
She sent her son to a school…… is very expensive.
He is rich and generous, ………... .
They drove ……to be in the meeting on time.
questionsData.explain_answer:
They drove fast to be in the meeting on time."

fast is an adverb that describes the speed of their driving. It indicates that they were driving quickly in order to reach the meeting on time.

  • Faster: This comparative form suggests a higher degree of speed than "fast." However, in this context, "faster" may not be the most appropriate choice because it implies a comparison with a previous speed or another vehicle's speed, which is not indicated in the sentence.

  • Slowly: This adverb suggests a low or reduced speed. However, in the given sentence, the intention was to reach the meeting on time, so driving slowly would be counterproductive.

  • Fastest: This superlative form indicates the highest degree of speed among multiple options. However, in the sentence, there is no comparison or reference to other vehicles or speeds, so using "fastest" would not be suitable.

questionsData.title: Salem …… on the phone with his friend two days ago.
She ……to Cairo next week.
When she came home yesterday, her mother ……lunch.
After they …… their homework they watched TV.
Grains ……in Yemen these days.
questionsData.explain_answer:
The best option to complete the sentence about grains growing in Yemen these days is:Are grown

Here's why:

Grows is singular, while "grains" is plural. We need a verb form that agrees with the plural subject.
Grow is also present tense, which might not be entirely accurate. While some grains are likely always grown in Yemen, we don't necessarily know the current state of grain production.
Are grown is the present passive voice, which indicates that grains are currently being cultivated in Yemen. This is the most appropriate choice because it reflects an ongoing action.
Grew is past tense, which wouldn't be suitable unless you're specifically talking about grains that were grown in the past.
